derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (as a verb): probably frequentative, from the base of poke and pocket (suggesting the formation of small purse-like gatherings)

entry.def: When a part of your face puckers or when you pucker it, it becomes tight or stretched, often because you are trying not to cry or are going to kiss someone.

example.ex: She puckered her lips into a rosebud and kissed him on the nose.
example.tran: 她双唇努起犹如一朵玫瑰花蕾，在他的鼻子上吻了一下。

means.word_mean: 1. an irregular fold in an otherwise even surface (as in cloth)
1. to gather something into small wrinkles or folds;
2. draw fabric together and sew it tightly

example.en: Don't get in such a pucker!
Close your pucker. You talk too much.
example.zh: 闭上你的嘴。你说得太多了。
